turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about Africanis.
turn.1: What is the name of the breed Africanis?
turn.2: Africanis The Africanis is a landrace of Southern African dogs.
turn.4: It is believed to be of ancient origin, directly descended from hounds and pariah dogs of ancient Africa, introduced into the Nile Valley from the Levant.
turn.5: Are there any other interesting aspects about this article?
turn.6: Africanis is also an umbrella name for all the aboriginal dogs in Southern Africa.
turn.8: While the Africanis Society of Southern Africa has conceptualised the Eurocentric term of "Africanis" to encapsulate all African breeds of dog, there do exist numerous specialised types developed by various African ethnic groups with their own indigenous and ancient names.
turn.10: These types are not "landraces" as dictated by the Africanis Society, but rather unusual types developed for certain specific conditions and that do exhibit differences in one type from the other.
turn.11: What is the most important fact in regards to the Africanis?
turn.12: The Africanis Society of Southern Africa aims to conserve the Africanis as a landrace rather than develop it as a breed.
